data.title: "Ctrl + Click To Follow Link" on Windows w/Git Bash just does a Paste

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0 Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Using VC Code Insiders on Windows 10, and the integrated terminal set to Git Bash ("C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe"),

1. Do something to show a link in the terminal window (eg ng lint that shows errors)
2. Ctrl + Click a file to open that file

This will result in whatever is in the copy/paste pasteboard to be entered into the terminal and the link is not followed.

data.title: powershell run selection not functional
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (06e162bb2913ce6dd394bd01c7dc4be9a7aa5991, 2017-05-22T05:14:07.368Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a new file using the welcome screen
2. set the language to powershell
3. type in some code
    a. for example "$b = 5"
4. click on that line of code
5. press the F8 key

expected result: code executed in terminal and $b variable is accessible
actual result: line of code has been copied to the terminal and has not been executed
testing: this issue happens in a new file and in a saved file, pressing ctrl+shift+p shows the 'run selection' option but it has the same effect. This does work in the vscode stable build.

data.title: Add Command: Keyboard assignable DebugOutput Copy All
data.body:
Add complementary keyboard command to copy all debug output.
Use new base from recently added Context Menu option

data.title: Make terminal runner the default for new tasks.json.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

If the user generates a new tasks.json or if he auto detects tasks we should switch to the new terminal runner. If an old tasks.json exists we still execute in the old output runner.

data.title: [macOS] Replace keyboard shortcut does not work
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

`Replace` keyboard shortcut does not work.
```json
{
  "command": "editor.action.startFindReplaceAction",
  "key": "alt+cmd+f"
}
```

Choosing the corresponding menu option works fine.

`Find` shortuct also works fine.
```json
{
  "command": "actions.find",
  "key": "cmd+f"
}
```

data.title: "Format selection as..." function
data.body:
Hi,

This is a feature request.

Currently there are "Format Document" and "Format Selection", they are both nice, except, a code files may have different formatting rules for different parts.

For example, in `Go`, a file may have some `SQL` in a string inside some `Go` code, being able to select that code and apply "Format selection as...", and select `SQL` formatter from the menu would help a lot.

Same goes for other files, for example `.vue` files, contain some `HTML` and `JavaScript`, and the Vue.js extension is not formatting the template part, but being able to select the template, and apply `HTML` formatting only to that part would be great.

I hope that the VSCode team would consider this addition. Thanks a lot.

No syntax highlighting, and I did not find how to switch the syntax highlight scheme for the current file (tab).

data.title: windows set terminal to bash cause workspaceRoot incorrect
data.body:
My question is similar to issue [20097](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20097)，it was closed
in Feb 8,but i still face this problem,my vscode version:1.12.2

"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe",
 launch.json:
```
{
    "type": "node",
    "request": "launch",
    "name": "Nodemon",
    "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/nodemon",
    "args": ["--config", "nodemon.json"],
    "protocol": "inspector",
    "runtimeArgs": [
      "--inspect=5858"
    ],
    "port": 5858,
    "console": "integratedTerminal"
  }
```
console error:"bash: e:fda_hch/node_modules/.bin/nodemon: No such file or directory"
i think it lose '/' in my workspaceRoot.
swith:'protocol': 'legacy',and "--inspect=5858" to "debug=5858" not solve my problem,timeout and suggest
me to use inspector.

data.title: Workbench theme customisation for forground tab colour of inactive group appears to be missing
data.body:
I cannot find a way of changing the foreground colour of tabs that are in the inactive group. The background colour of the active for both inactive and active group seems to be mapped to the same. 

I would proposed to separate active and inactive group and expose that through the workbench.colorCustomizations settings. 

Thanks

data.title: Investigate improving Git SCM as done by GitHub for Atom
data.body:
Investigate ways of improving **Git SCM** for **VSCode** by providing features present in **GitHub for Atom**. They did an excellent job of providing most of actions used when working on a project with **Git** as source control.

For more info, take a look at [GitHub for Atom](https://github.atom.io/).

data.title: Use an iframe for I/O
Add workspace setting to save SCM Provider
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: all

Each project should be able to config and preserve their SCM provider.

E.g. `/folderX` uses p4 and `/folderY` uses git.

Related:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26198

data.title: */shell.i18n.json lost some translations in 2017-05-19. Merged in translations.
data.body: prof.* series in i18n/*/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/shell.i18n.json of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/bd14b32aeaaec846f41a8ceaee90752e7198354b#diff-971b16c06708ca467431abcce9760104.

data.title: Ctrl + Click = go to link shortcut === bad UX
data.body: In Windows the key shortcut to go to a link is CTRL + Click. While editing you select code and CTRL + C to copy allot. While doing this you will go to a link instead if you already pressed CTRL while selecting.

data.title: Show Disabled Extensions at the Bottom of Extensions List

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It's not a majorly important feature but It would help Immensely. Cycling through disabled extensions on the list while looking for a specific one can be quite disturbing. There's  a filter for showing disabled only extensions "@disabled" so I assume the feature wouldn't be that hard to implement.

data.title: Show Disable/Enable all extensions actions in the Extensions viewlet context menu
data.body: Show Disable/Enable all extensions actions in the Extensions viewlet context menu to make it easy to verify that an issue is from an extension.

data.title: tmLanguage for at least .cpp and .cs files require some little improvements
data.body: cpp language selectors doesnt support **user types**/**classes** detection whereas its partialy supported for .cs files. Here is the result for both. .cpp : user types are **"blind"**, or rather uaware, also some keywords are missinterpreted,please see _**class**_ declaration. .cs : user types are only partialy detected. however _**class**_ keyword has been properly spotted.
